attributes.action: Declare the result of the 2016 EU Referendum null and void
attributes.additional_details: Less than 40% support cannot be construed as a democratic mandate for such a cataclysmic decision. Many Leave voters already regret their choice as the constitutional and economic implications become clear. The decision to invoke Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty to take the UK out of the EU is so important that it must have the overwhelming support of the British people, which is not the case. Otherwise, the democratic rights of all those people who did not vote to leave will have been violated.
attributes.background: Less than 40% of the eligible electorate (only 17.5 million out of 46 million) actually voted to leave the EU.
